description: The Quran Association Manager application follows a clear, layered architecture typical of Electron applications, separating the user interface from the backend logic and data persistence. The core of the application revolves around five main components: the Renderer Process (UI Application), the IPC Communication Layer, the Electron Main Process, Business Logic Services, and the Database Access Layer. This structure ensures a responsive user experience, efficient inter-process communication, and robust data management.

components.name: Renderer Process (UI Application)
components.description: The React-based frontend, responsible for rendering the user interface, handling user input, and displaying application data.

components.name: IPC Communication Layer
components.description: The secure and asynchronous communication bridge facilitating data and command exchange between the Electron Main and Renderer processes.

components.name: Electron Main Process
components.description: The Node.js backend, orchestrating application lifecycle, native OS interactions, and delegating tasks to business logic.

components.name: Business Logic Services
components.description: Encapsulates all core application logic, including authentication, student management, financial operations, attendance tracking, data import/export, and settings management.

components.name: Database Access Layer
components.description: Provides an abstraction for interacting with the local SQLite database (.db/quran_assoc_manager.sqlite), ensuring data persistence, retrieval, and basic data integrity.

components.name: Unclassified
components.description: Component for all unclassified files and utility functions (Utility functions/External Libraries/Dependencies)
